column26: Named after a popular NSYNC song, this is a natural but punchy color with deep shadows and a gentle highlight lift. Greens and yellows get a little glow, blues run a touch darker, which keeps skies rich and skin tones clean straight out of camera.
Jerred recommends it for city and garden shots.
WIth in-camera raw editor, add a Yellow/Orange hue color creator effect with level +2

Nostalgic Summer is a vintage inspired recipe that focuses on vibrant greens and golden yellows while stripping away blues for a more timeless look. Ideal for capturing contrasty, sunny days by delivering a filmic look straight out of camera
OM-CHROME was designed to capture the vibrant colors of daily urban life geared to emulate the classic look of 35mm positive slide film.

column25:
Slightly underexpose and use your histogram.
This one can clip highlights fast.
column26:
Vibe: Slide film feel. High punch, crisp edges, moody shadows.
Best for: City scenes, golden hour, strong shapes
Avoid in: Overcast or extreme contrast without careful metering

Vibe: Clean, neutral, contrasty but calm. Think Fuji Provia or 400H.
Best for: Sunset, travel, versatile light
Avoid in: Flat or overcast light. It can look a little lifeless.

column25: Slightly overexpose for a softer feel.
column26:
Vibe: Meyerowitz/Cape Light. Soft, dreamy, pastel with luminous highlights.
Best for: Overcast, open shade, late afternoon or blue hour
Avoid in: Harsh sunlight. It washes out fast.

Vibe: Golden, punchy, rich skin tones. A bit of that Kodak warmth.
Best for: Cool early morning or midday sun, beachy or dappled light, clean outdoor scenes
Avoid in: Indoor tungsten or golden-hour light. It gets too warm.

This color profile boosts warm and cool tones while dialing back greens and magentas, letting complementary colors stand out. With softer contrast, lifted shadows, lowered highlights, and reduced sharpness, the result feels balanced, natural, and true to the scene.

This is where I captured the wild beauty of exotic plants and brought their colors to life through my lens, amplifying the saturated greens of the lush jungle canopy and intensifying the vivid magentas and warm tones of tropical blooms to recreate the untamed vibrancy of the rainforest.
warms up the overall tones, makes the reds "pop" while muting yellows and greens ever so slightly. It also softens the image for a bit more dream-like feel.

For this edit, I built a look that feels true to my style desaturated blues, warm mids, and those orange-red tones that really pop. Itâ€™s all balanced with a subtle filmy curve that gives it that nostalgic, cinematic finish for the golden hour.
